content: Yes, Kerri Strug was a member of the U.S. Women's gymnastics team in the 1996 Olympics and competed at the Georgia Dome. Her vault performance during the team finals is perhaps one of the most iconic gymnastics moments in Olympic history. Strug injured her ankle during her first vault attempt but made a heroic second vault on an injured ankle, landing on one foot, to help secure the gold medal for her team. This moment cemented her as a legend in gymnastics and Olympic history, and it is still remembered and celebrated to this day.
